DOC.brief_summary: The proposed study aims to characterize the effects of running-specific leg prosthetic stiffness and height during on performance during running and sprinting to optimize running-specific prosthesis prescription. The investigators will collect biomechanical and metabolic data from participants with unilateral and bilateral below the knee amputations while they run at different speeds on a treadmill. This data will be used to understand the effects of running prostheses. Then, these parameters will be used to develop prosthetic prescription techniques for people with below the knee amputations.
DOC.brief_title: What is the Optimal Stiffness and Height of a Running-specific Prosthesis?
DOC.criteria: bilateral or unilateral transtibial amputation at least one year of running experience using runningspecific prostheses 1855 years old no current problems with their prosthesis or residual limb at a K4 Medicare Functional Classification Level Cardiovascular, pulmonary, or neurological disease or disorder
